actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Roll Call 54
actions-list.actionItem: Yea and Nay vote pending.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4090 — "To codify certain provisions of certain Executive Orders relating to domestic mining and hardrock mineral resources, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to recommit H.R. 4090, passage of the bill, if ordered, and passage of H.J. Res. 142.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 4.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to the situation in and in relation to Burma declared in Executive Order 14014 of February 10, 2021, is to continue in effect beyond February 10, 2026
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-130).

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 142, the Chair put the question on passage of the joint resolution and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Frost demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 142.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 142 and H.R. 4090. The resolution provides for consideration of the Senate amendments to H.R. 7148. Also, the resolution provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 142 and H.R. 4090 under a closed rule and provides for one motion to recommit H.R. 4090.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1032. H.J. Res. 142 — "Disapproving the action of the District of Columbia Council in approving the D.C. Income and Franchise Tax Conformity and Revision Temporary Amendment Act of 2025."

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 4090, the Chair put the question on motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Ms. Leger Fernandez demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Leger Fernandez moved to recommit to the Committee on Natural Resources.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 4090.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 142 and H.R. 4090. The resolution provides for consideration of the Senate amendments to H.R. 7148. Also, the resolution provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 142 and H.R. 4090 under a closed rule and provides for one motion to recommit H.R. 4090.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1032. H.R. 4090 — "To codify certain provisions of certain Executive Orders relating to domestic mining and hardrock mineral resources, and for other purposes."

The House received a communication from Ben Thomas, Chief of Staff, Representative Joaquin Castro. Pursuant to Rule VIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives, Mr. Thomas notified the House that he had been served with a subpoena in a criminal trial issued by the United States District Court for the District of Nevada and that after consultation with the Office of General Counsel, he had determined that compliance with the subpoena is consistent with the privileges and rights of the House.

The House received a communication from Joaquin Castro, Member of Congress. Pursuant to Rule VIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives, Mr. Castro (TX) notified the House that he had been served with subpoenas in a criminal trial issued by the United States District Court for the District of Nevada and after consultation with the Office of General Counsel, he had determined that compliance with the subpoenas are consistent with the privileges and rights of the House.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Morelle to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 4.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Tracey Mann to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
